creditline: Gift of Steve and Gail Berger
dimension: 8 1/2 x 16 1/2 in. (21.6 x 41.9 cm) (strap and tassels excluded)
text: The rectangular 19th-century coca leaf bag (ch’uspa) with a human motif is a common style woven out of alpaca fiber. This particular ch’uspa is unusual as the woven parts are rudimentarily sewn together instead of woven. The woven section is of a warp-faced plain weave with bands of complementary weave and a woven fragment of a strap.
title: Coca Leaf Bag
